img.alt: HUSD #1 IN BEST PLACE TO TEACH IN ARIZONA

img.style: border-width:0px;width: 41px; vertical-align: middle; padding: 10px; border-left: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12); border-right: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12); float:right; margin-top:-10px;

strong.span: Welcome to Holbrook Unified School District #3 - Home of the Holbrook Roadrunners!

We are committed to
Helping each Unique Student Develop:
Personally, Academically, and Socially
for overall Success!

img.title: food services
img.a: HUSD FOOD SERVICE GUIDELINES UPDATED APRIL 17, 2020

strong.span: BEGINNING MONDAY, APRIL 20th, HUSD WILL BEGIN FOOD SERVICE DELIVERIES ON
MONDAY
S
AND
THURSDAYS
ONLY. BREAKFAST AND LUNCH WILL BE PROVIDED FOR THREE DAYS ON MONDAY AND THREE DAYS ON THURSDAYS.
Please note:

FOOD SERVICE DELIVERY TIMES WILL REMAIN THE SAME; HOWEVER, DUE TO THE VOLUME OF FOOD DELIVERED THERE MAY BE UP TO A 30 MINUTE DELAY FOR DELIVERY. PLEASE BE PATIENT AND WE WILL DELIVER AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. EVERY PICK UP LOCATION WILL HAVE FOOD DELIVERED TO IT ON MONDAY AND THURSDAY OF EACH WEEK!
THIS WIL REDUCE THE EXPOSURE RATES FOR OUR STAFF AND FOR PARENTS. THERE WILL BE NO DELIVERY ON TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY AND FRIDAY.

li.strong: Educational materials will be delivered on Thursdays of each week! Parents may also pick up deliverable packets at Park, Hulet, HJHS and HHS on Thursdays as well from 10 am -12 pm.

strong.span: We appreciate your cooperation and participation. We are serving almost 3,000 meals a day to Help our Unique Students Develop!

img.title: wfi
img.a: WIFI PARK AND SURF LOCATIONS BEGIN MONDAY, APRIL 20TH

div.strong: Beginning Monday, April 20th the Holbrook School District in partnership with Northern Arizona University and the Navajo Nation will begin offering public wifi in parking lots at each campus. This is a public service offered by HUSD #3, NAU and the Navajo Nation to keep our stakeholders connected during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Wifi access will be limited to parking lots only. Please do not come onto campus. You will be asked to leave. In addition, we ask that you stay in your vehicles while utilizing the wifi.

td.a: VIRTUAL PARENT AND STUDENT FORUM HOSTED AT HUSD #3 ON THURSDAY at 3 PM

strong.span: Please join our HUSD #3 leadership team for a virtual forum to address school closures. The links below take you to viewing pages only. If you wish to view and submit questions you must view through Facebook - you can like our page and join the discussion by clicking on the links below.

span.strong: Student and parent forum will be live at 3 pm from the Roadrunner Roost. Please submit any questions ahead of time to: [email protected] or you can stream questions live during the broadcast.
Watch Facebook Live Stream here and ask questions:

a.style: color: #1155cc; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.strong: Links will be live by 2:30 pm on Thursday.
We hope you can join us!

strong.span: Holbrook High School yearbooks are now on sale. Anyone interested may purchase yearbooks online at:
https://holbrookhs.store.creatorstudiopro.com/
When yearbooks arrive those that purchased will be notified for pick up procedures.
Be well Roadrunners!

div.strong: Today, Monday, March 30, 2020 Governor Ducey declared that all schools will be closed for the remainder of the school year.

HUSD #3 will continue to offer learning in two modalities: distance learning via online programs and deliverable learning via school learning packets delivered via our school lunch and breakfast program; as well as, picking up packets from schools.
School closures simply means that school campuses will not be open for students for the remainder of the year; however, we are committed to ensuring learning will continue at HUSD #3.
We understand these are complex times and we want students and parents to know that we are here to help all Roadrunners succeed!
We plan to host a public forum this Thursday at 1 pm and a student forum at 2 pm via Facebook Live. At that time we will be available to answer questions and address concerns.

br.strong: Please stay healthy and thank you for being Roadrunners!

strong.span: Please use the Arizona Department of Education website for Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ):
https://www.azed.gov/communications/2020/03/10/guidance-to-schools-on-covid-19/

br.span:
Holbrook Unified School District strives to meet the Personal, Academic, and Social needs of our student population with the end goal of general Success (PASS). This mission does not change amid concerns of of the coronavirus (COVID19). It has certainly changed how we approach this mission with schools closed for the indefinite future to promote social distancing in hopes of "flattening the curve."
READ MORE About the Child Nutrition Delivery Program!
